cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 85 miles ESE of Caibarien, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving west but forecast to turn northwest today, then track up the Florida Keys and the Florida peninsula, curving inland over Georgia/Alabama by Tuesday–Wednesday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Keys / southwest coast of Florida

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch north of the Volusia/Brevard County Line FL to Fernandina Beach and from Anclote River FL to Indian Pass FL (no Mississippi counties included)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Volusia/Brevard County Line southward around the Florida peninsula to Anclote River including the Keys; Tropical-Storm Warning along parts of north-coast Cuba
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida peninsula, Florida Keys, southeast Georgia and later inland Georgia/Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤5%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts 20–30 kt possible late Monday into Tuesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the Mississippi coast from Irma
weather_observation.rainfall: Showers with locally 1–3 inches possible Monday night–Tuesday as Irma’s outer rain-bands pass inland to the east
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated brief tornadoes in outer rain-bands cannot be ruled out but probability is very low at the port
